intro: Withania chamaesarachoides, commonly known as the desert nightshade, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades such as tomatoes and peppers. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and oval-shaped, fleshy fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to withstand high temperatures and limited water availability. Due to its resilience, it is often found in disturbed habitats and along coastal areas.
